lexUnit.definition: COD: be equal to in quality or strength

sentence.text: She surrendered herself to the melting awareness that was building within her , and her exploration of his mouth matched his in eagerness and abandonment .
Her manner matched his in abruptness .
If his peers were equal there to the King , then the King must be seen to match them in knowledge , and to give his judgments without leaning on the advice of a mentor .
For anyone interested in history , 1989 was clearly a year to match 1789 or 1914 in the momentous import of events in Eastern Europe .
Even though shorn of the banker that was Craig Chalmers , it matches the size of the Scotland representation in New Zealand in 1983 though one fewer than in Australia in 1989 .
In 11 out of 16 industries the concentration ratio declined , reflecting the greater degree of competition as European and Japanese firms began to match US firms for size .
With this in mind we can see that the indulgent familiarity of the maternal uncle towards his nephew matches the mother 's generous affection towards her child .
If a match is found , the process matches the next MRPA symbol in the transcription against the set of branches following the initial branch .
She stole a glance at him ; his features matched the ice in his tone and his eyes surpassed it .
But although there was a multiplicity of ( short ) railway systems in Venezuela , its relative lack of railway development matched its comparative economic backwardness .
Mary was no longer scared of Mum ; she stood up to her and matched her temper .
As go-between , the area supervisor has a sense of responsibility towards his seniors matching his sense of loyalty to his field staff .
The wonder is that Purcell , seemingly unable to turn out a pot-boiler even for minor events , produced ten substantial movements which in their vigour and imagination match the royal odes .
` I do n't know what you 're talking about , " she said , her tone matching his .
ICI has been trying to develop substitutes for halons 1211 and 1301 , but as yet none of the agents under trial match their performance .
Powered by a four-stroke engine , running on unleaded petrol , the junior-sized version does n't quite match the performance of its 180 mph big brother .
BT believes it still has some way to go before it can match the performance of American telecommunications companies and is also anxious to stay ahead of European public sector rivals .
The three ships swirled around my ship , neatly bracketing it as they matched its speed .
However for us to match the skill of the chameleon we require two eyes , for we judge depth primarily by comparing the two overlapping views we receive .
The regularity of the seasons matches the regularity of the great Christian festivals of Christmas , Easter and Pentecost .
This , his last concerto , was the first great concerto for the clarinet , and nothing has come near to matching it among all of the wind concertos written since .
`` The result is a generation of young people whose ignorance and intellectual incompetence is matched only by their good opinion of themselves .

One of the biologists ' jobs , according to chief scientist Bernard Courtney , will be to create pathogens to match strains that terrorists are clandestinely producing and then develop vaccines and drugs to combat them .
As Athens rose in influence and power in the West , it was matched in the East by the rise of the Persian Empire .
Unfortunately , their zeal was not matched by their discrimination .
No matter how many tunnels and transit systems speed cross - harbor traffic , nothing matches the ride on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to the Central District across Victoria Harbor .
